sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using inverse matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations below using inverse matrices method:

2x + 3y - z = 10 
 x -  y + z = -1 
3x + 2y + z = 15
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using the inverse matrices method, we first write the given system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 2  3 -1 |
    | 1 -1  1 |
    | 3  2  1 |

X = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

B = | 10  |
    | -1  |
    | 15  |

Now, we need to find the inverse of matrix A, denoted as A^(-1). To do this, we first find the determinant of A.

det(A) = 2(-1 - 2) - 3(1 - 3) - (-1)(2 + 6) = 2(-3) - 3(-2) + 8 = -6 + 6 + 8 = 8

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of A exists. Now, we find the adjugate of A and divide each element by the determinant.

adj(A) = | (-1 - 2)  (1 - 3)  (2 + 6)  |
         | (1 - 3)   (2 - 6)  (3 - 6)  |
         | (2 - 6)   (3 - 1)  (6 - 9)  |

adj(A) = | -3  -2  8 |
         | -2  -4  -3 |
         | -4   2  -3 |

Now, we find A^(-1) by dividing each element of adj(A) by the determinant of A.

A^(-1) = (1/8) * | -3  -2  8  |
                 | -2  -4  -3 |
                 | -4   2  -3 |

Now, we multiply A^(-1) by B to find the solution matrix X.

X = A^(-1) * B

X = (1/8) * | -3  -2  8  | * | 10  |
            | -2  -4  -3 |   | -1  |
            | -4   2  -3 |   | 15  |

X = (1/8) * | -3(10) - 2(-1) + 8(15)  |
            | -2(10) - 4(-1) - 3(15) |
            | -4(10) + 2(-1) - 3(15) |

X = (1/8) * | -30 + 2 + 120 |
            | -20 + 4 - 45  |
            | -40 - 2 - 45  |

X = (1/8) * | 92  |
            | -61 |
            | -87 |

X = |  11.5 |
    | -7.625|
    | -10.875|

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 11.5, y = -7.625, and z = -10.875.
